jobDescription: Thornton Tomasetti provides engineering design, investigation and analysis services to clients worldwide on projects of every size and level of complexity. We are a growing 1200+ person firm with practices in the following disciplines: Structural Engineering, Forensics, Applied Science, Renewal, Property Loss Consulting, Construction Engineering, Protective Design, Facade Engineering, Sustainability and Transportation. We work on landmarks to exhibitions from the historic to the high performing while balancing multiple objectives which include form, function, schedule, sustainability, constructability and budget. At our core, TALENT is the center of our business.  As a Mechanical (Machinery) Engineering Intern at Thornton Tomasetti, you will have the opportunity to take part in the following: Responsibilities: - Mechanical and structural analysis, layout and design of mechanical systems and structural supports.  - Coordination of design work with in-house staff as well as other design professionals including Architects and other Engineering disciplines  - Preparation of construction documents within a BIM environment RequirementsUndergraduate or graduate student with concentration in engineering or architecture.Excellent academic record.Comfort with communicating with others in person, over the phone, and via email.Experience using Microsoft Excel for data management desirable.Experience in Revit, Tekla, and AutoCAD helpful, but not required.
